H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H539.def: = state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H3126.def: = young branch growing from the stump or stem of a tree or plant

H8328.def: = a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well-being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind

H6723.def: = state in which there is a lack of water or rainfall, ► resulting in lack of vegetation and other desert-like conditions

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H8389.def: = the shape of (part of) the body of humans and animals; ≈ mostly used in contexts emphasizing the beauty of someone's face and figure

H1926.def: = state in which deities, humans, or animals have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H4758.def: = the part of an object that can be seen with the eye

H2530.def: = process by which humans or deities experience an eager desire for a person or object

H959.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H2310.def: = process by which humans exist in this world for a short time only

H4341.def: = state in which humans are physically wounded

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H2483.def: = state in which humans are lacking physical strength, ◄ as a result of sickness or injury

H4564.def: literally: hiding (one's) face; hence: = causative action by which humans cover their face in order to be unable to see or be seen

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H403.def: = marker used to affirm the truth of the following statement

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H2483.def: = state in which humans are lacking physical strength, ◄ as a result of sickness or injury

H4341.def: = state in which humans are physically wounded

H587.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H5060.def: = process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, whether deliberately or not

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6031.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H2490.def: = action by which priests disqualify themselves for religious service ◄ by unlawful behavior

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H1792.def: = causative action by which an object is deformed or pulverized by exerting heavy pressure on it

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H2250.def: = area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by sickness or aggression; ≈ sometimes used in a figurative sense to refer to difficult circumstances

H7495.def: = causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans or animals to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself; ≈ often used figuratively to denote the state of a country or nation suffering from the consequences of their unfaithfulness

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H6437.def: = action by which humans or animals turn their body to face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6293.def: = process by which humans or animals unexpectedly meet other humans or animals while travelling from one location to another

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

24.gl: to cause (something) to meet (someone) > to make (someone) responsible for (something)

H5065.def: = a person who forces humans and animals to perform certain activities

H6031.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H2986.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or inanimate objects to move or be moved from one place to another

H7716.def: = an individual member of a group of {L:sheep<SDBH:כֶּבֶשׂ>} and {L:goats<SDBH:עֵז>} traveling and feeding together

H2874.def: = causative action by which humans kill animals by slicing the jugular vein and windpipe with a sharp-bladed instrument, ► to prepare its meat for a meal; ≈ associated with aggression

H1494.def: = causative action by which humans cut off their hair, or the wool of a sheep or other animal

H481.def: = to be unable to speak ◄ because of a physical limitation or because of emotions

H6115.def: literally: closure of womb; hence: = state in which a woman is unable to conceive

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H7878.def: = action by which humans produce inarticulate sounds expressing distress

H1504.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide objects into two halves

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H5061.def: = a disease or sickness or wound ◄ caused by another person or sent from God or a deity ► to punish a person or nation for some wrong or disobedience

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H6913.def: = place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2555.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans, ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

H4820.def: = action by which humans cause other humans to believe something that is not true; ► the result can be dangerous or destructive to what was once a trusting relationship

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2654.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H1792.def: = causative action by which an object is deformed or pulverized by exerting heavy pressure on it

H2470.def: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H817.def: = state of being responsible for an unlawful deed, that was committed either knowingly or unknowingly

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H748.def: = to be long or to increase in length

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H2656.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H6743.def: = action by which an outside force (perhaps divine) quickly comes over a person, gaining control over the person or causing some immediate outcome

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H6663.def: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

10.gl: to have (one's) fill > to be contented

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6099.def: = state in which humans or animals are numerous and therefore potentially powerful

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H6168.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause the outer layer covering an object to be removed

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H4487.def: = action with which one determines or estimates the number of a collection of persons, objects, or events

H6586.def: = action by which a person or group challenges or defies an authority or agreement

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H2399.def: = state in which a human being is responsible for a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether committed on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

H6293.def: = process by which humans or animals unexpectedly meet other humans or animals while travelling from one location to another
